sentences.sentence: Skip to content ← → Dr. Smith is Very Optimistic About Hydroxychloroquine Treatment: “This is the beginning of the end of the pandemic”… Posted on April 2, 2020 by sundance Dr. Stephen Smith, and infectious disease specialist, appears on Fox News with Laura Ingraham to discuss his work dealing with COVID-19 patients and his protocol of using Hydroxychloroquine as a treatment.
Dr. Smith reports that no patient who has undergone the Hydroxycholoquine treatment has required intubation (a ventilator).
That positive outcome is statistically impossible if the hydroxychloroquine treatment regime did not work.

Unfortunately a fast, efficient and inexpensive treatment protocol is against the interests of Big Pharma, Bill Gates, Dr. Fauci and the global medical complex that manipulates world health for maximum power and profit.
Share this: WhatsApp LinkedIn Like this: This entry was posted in , , CDC , , , , , , , , Election 2020 , , , media bias , , Political correctness/cultural marxism , propaganda , , , USA .

← → 246 Responses to Dr. Smith is Very Optimistic About Hydroxychloroquine Treatment: “This is the beginning of the end of the pandemic”… ← says: April 2, 2020 at 9:57 pm Just out of curiosity I noticed that the number of cases and deaths from Corona virus in tropical Africa are very low considering the lack of all resources in these countries.
I would assume that malaria would be common in these countries and if so are anti malarial drugs widely consumed there and is this the reason for the low number of virus cases and deaths.
Liked by 5 people roddrepub says: April 3, 2020 at 9:58 am I’ve not thought of it that way but you’re right!

ATheoK says: April 3, 2020 at 3:47 pm Dr. Roy Spencer pointed put that countries with malaria infections had a very low incidence, comparatively, than countries where malaria is uncommon to nonexistent.

https://wattsupwiththat.com/2020/03/17/an-effective-treatment-for-coronavirus-covid-19-has-been-found-in-a-common-anti-malarial-drug/ That situation has not changed greatly since mid-March: https://covid19info.live/ Dr. Spencer is not a medical doctor.
But, he was struck early on that malarial countries were not propagating COVID-19 like countries where malaria is uncommon.
SM says: April 4, 2020 at 9:06 am I’ve read an article along these lines.
the reason this drug was even considered was that in the beginning of the epidemic in china Drs noticed that people with Lupas did NOT catch the coronavirus, this led them to consider why.
the underlying commonality between the lupus patients were they all took hydrocloriquin for Lupas….
so along your lines, You is very likely onto the pinpointing factor in Africa.
MARK KAPPES says: April 4, 2020 at 12:13 pm You are 100% correct.
Also, social distancing from huge throngs of people are not an issue in Sub-Saharan Africa.
The other wild card here is sickle cell.
This is an avenue that I hope that the 70 pound heads are exploring.
88USA says: April 8, 2020 at 4:39 am U. S. Personnel serving in Vietnam received weekly doses of anti-malarial medication; most likely Chloroquine.
However, indigenous peoples who were being stung by the same malaria carrying mosquitoes never needed the drug.
Some peoples have genetically developed immunity.
After all, Europeans who invaded the Americas brought a variety of diseases with them the indigenous people had no natural immunity to.
philialetheist says: April 2, 2020 at 10:03 pm Perhaps people should all be taking zinc supplements.
Chloroquine work by forcing zinc into the cells where the zinc destroys the virus’s ability to replicate.
says: April 2, 2020 at 10:27 pm Doesn’t do much good to take zinc without something like that, it has a hard time getting in there.

stakan says: April 4, 2020 at 6:35 am Some natural substances may not have the full effect of a drug like chloroquine, but work similarly, improving Zinc’s effectiveness – thinking green tea extract (EGCG) and less so Quercetin (bioflavonoid that in large amounts can act like a natural antihistamine – often in Vit C pills).
And speaking of C & Zn, if people are reacting to virus by taking large quantities of C, they should watch the Zn also.
says: April 3, 2020 at 8:39 am My out-patient treatment regimen is as follows: 1.
Hydroxychloroquine 200mg twice a day for 5 days 2.
Azithromycin 500mg once a day for 5 days 3.

Zinc sulfate 220mg once a day for 5 days https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SesxgaPnpT6OfCYuaFSwXzDK4cDKMbivoALprcVFj48/mobilebasic says: April 2, 2020 at 10:20 pm It does not take a rocket scientist, or a viral expert to surmise it would be much more efficient and effective to mass produce hydroxychloroquine than respirators.
With one you need less of the other.
And one is easier and cheaper to manufacture.
It is down right disgusting there are many in this country, and most of the media, rooting for the virus instead of the country.
TDS is a much bigger threat to the Nation than the virus.
Liked by 5 people says: April 3, 2020 at 12:11 am Respirators are more profitable than hydroxychloroquine.
That’s all that matters to Big Med.
Liked by 3 people says: April 2, 2020 at 10:32 pm No money in HCQ, it’s way past patent protection and you can create 50-gallon drums of it for pennies.

Liked by 2 people says: April 2, 2020 at 10:36 pm Dr. William Grace: ‘Thanks to hydroxychloroquine, we have not had a death in our hospital.’ https://techstartups.com/2020/03/30/dr-william-grace-thanks-hydroxychloroquine-not-death-hospital/ Liked by 3 people dallasdan says: April 2, 2020 at 11:05 pm …to the great disappointment of many people.
I read a post listing the symptoms of coronavirus and in the comments there were a whole lot of people saying “wow, I had something like that in January, I thought it was a really bad cold”.
When I listed the the symptoms for my daughter she said ‘I think I had that in January, remember I had that really bad cold”.
Today while speaking with my nephew he told me that he and his partner wonder if they had the virus already.
He told me that in January someone at her work came back from a trip to Asia, got sick and most everyone at work caught it from him, and he caught it from her.
I told him about the article I read and my what my daughter said when I told her the symptoms – can all this be just a coincidence.
I wish there was a way we could find out how many people had an unusual cold in or around January.
So right here in my small circle there are three young people (under 55) who may have anti-bodies.

https://www.thegatewaypundit.com/2020/04/dr-fauci-says-his-immunity-testing-is-not-his-priority-would-help-leaders-know-when-to-restart-economy-video/ Liked by 4 people luiggi says: April 2, 2020 at 10:58 pm I live in Florida and my wife who works as a nurse got really sick in January.
She thought it was the flu but got tested and it came back negative.
She had a horrendous cough for 2 weeks and a fever.
It took about a week before I got it which was unusual.
Usually when she gets sick I catch it pretty quickly.
My symptoms were mild but highly unusual.
Fatigue that lasted weeks even though I never felt really sick like my wife.
I also had a headache that lasted about 5 days which is unusual as I average about 2 headaches a year.
I was more worried about the headaches than anything else.
Also another symptom of Corona is loss of smell which I had after my symptoms were gone.
I couldn’t smell or taste anything.
At the time both my wife and I felt it was the most unusual sickness we have ever had.
Liked by 5 people says: April 3, 2020 at 4:27 pm I hear you luiggi.
We had similar illnesses run through our family, as well.
I was exposed to a CCU patient -a dear friend- who died of ARDS in January.
During this time I suffered headaches and a sore throat.
The week he died I was treated for symptoms of pneumonia.
People in my neighborhood are now testing positive, and I know a few who were hospitalized.
My county just reported 43 COVID-related deaths overnight.
A month ago there were 4 positive cases recorded in Nassau county and now there are thousands.
I don’t think this virus is going away any time soon.
But I do think there is hope for those most at risk for serious complications, hospitalization and death.
They should receive the life-saving treatment as soon as possible.
Hydroxychloroquine + ZINC+ Azythromycin.
says: April 3, 2020 at 4:58 pm Persoanally i had the exact symptoms in January this year, i had travelled to UK and Germany late last year.
I was treated of pneumonia and bacteria infection back here in Nairobi, Kenya.
I can tell you am okay right now and very much cured.

He tested positive for influenza, but this seemed so much worse and dragged on and on with a high fever, a cough, and breathing problems.
Seems the Chinese students came back with this terrible flu and nearly everyone caught it.
They closed down the school for a couple weeks.

says: April 5, 2020 at 8:23 am I applaud the “The Right TO TRY ACT” by President Trump.
When the infectious disease like the CORONAVIRUS, which we don’t know anything about it.
I did research on the subject matter.

This viruses are very virulent.This virus causes severe lung injury causing death as Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome(ARDS),and Cerebral Edema causing Coma of the patient) Ventilators are not sufficient.
I discovered the use of CELL SPECIFIC CARBONIC ANHYDRASE ENZYMES AND ITS INHIBITORS(HTTPS:/WWW.CEREBRIL.COM/ ) TREATMENT FOR AGING,ETC.
Also the use of acetazolamide for cerebral edema(my expired patent).
This is a carbonic anhydrase inhibitor which a diuretic that passes the blood brain barrier, taking out H2O and H2CO3 from the brain cells hence the brain edema(coma) subsides.
It also inhibits the formation of H+(hydrogen) + adenosine diphosphate(ATP) = adenosine triphosphate(ATP)fuel for all living cells.
Cell Specific carbonic anhydrase inhibitors should be used.

It has also been used as a prophylactic and does not need a prescription.
Moreover if Z-pak becomes unavailable Ciprofloxacin has also been tested with HCQ.
